articles.title: BJP's Bihar Calculus: More MLAs, But Nitish Kumar Is Still The Boss
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on a political analysis of the upcoming Bihar Assembly elections, featuring key figures like Prashant Kishor, Nitish Kumar, and Tejashwi Yadav. The speaker, identified as political strategist Prashant Kishor, predicts significant losses for the ruling NDA, stating, ‘I can say with certainty that...Nitish Kumar will not return as chief minister.’. Kishor's analysis attributes the JD(U)'s reduced tally in the 2020 polls to the 'Chirag Paswan factor', where the LJP fielded candidates specifically against the JD(U), causing its numbers to drop to 43.

articles.title: ED approaches top court against release of IAS officer in money laundering case
articles.excerpt: The Enforcement Directorate has moved the Supreme Court with a Special Leave Petition, contesting the Bombay High Court's recent order that directed the release of Anilkumar Pawar, former commissioner of the Vasai Virar City Municipal Corporation (VVMC). Pawar, who had been under arrest for his alleged involvement in a money laundering case concerning the illegal construction of 41 buildings on government land in Vasai, was released after the High Court found his arrest to be unlawful. Citing its grounds of arrest, the ED said that when their officials conducted a search on Pawar's residence, he didn't open the door despite being inside, and even after repeated knocks for two hours.

articles.title: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu steps back from public engagements: ‘I have to ship some code’ | Mint
articles.excerpt: Sridhar Vembu, the founder and chief scientist of Zoho Corporation, announced on 15 October that he would take a temporary break from external engagements to focus on his core technical work. articles.title: Govt issues draft rules on OTT access for disabled
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has formulated draft Guidelines for Accessibility of Content on Platforms of Publishers of Online Curated Content (OTT Platforms) to make films and shows on streaming platforms accessible to persons with visual and hearing disabilities. The guidelines propose that new content uploaded on OTT platforms carry at least one accessibility feature — such as closed or open captioning, audio description, or Indian Sign Language interpretation — and that platforms progressively make their existing libraries accessible. articles.title: Positive Breakout: These 11 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs - Upside Ahead?
articles.excerpt: In the Nifty500 pack, 11 stocks' closing prices crossed above their 200 DMA (Daily Moving Averages) on October 16, 2025, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used by traders as a key indicator for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend.

articles.title: Singapore’s Swap Rates Are Set to Rise From a Three-Year Low
articles.excerpt: Traders are betting that Singapore’s swap rates will need to rise to offset an expected weakening of the currency. The city-state’s dollar is around the lowest levels in five months versus the greenback, which may put upward pressure on local rates. The central bank is also less likely to pump liquidity in the near-term, according to analysts.
articles.content_snippet: Traders are betting that Singapore’s swap rates will need to rise to offset an expected weakening of the currency. The city-state’s dollar is around the lowest levels in five months versus the greenback, which may put upward pressure on local rates. The central bank is also less likely to pump liquidity in the near-term, according to analysts. And while in the past Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts would help lower Singapore rates too, that link has broken down.

articles.title: Fed Staff Query Missing $1.4 Trillion Hedge Fund Treasuries Pile
articles.excerpt: Hedge funds in the Cayman Islands held more Treasuries at end-2024 than US official data show, with their ownership likely to be $1.4 trillion higher than reported, according to researchers at the Federal Reserve. The funds’ holdings had increased by $1 trillion since 2022 to reach $1.85 trillion by end-December, the researchers including Daniel Barth and Daniel Beltran wrote in an Oct. 15 note.
articles.content_snippet: Hedge funds in the Cayman Islands held more Treasuries at end-2024 than US official data show, with their ownership likely to be $1.4 trillion higher than reported, according to researchers at the Federal Reserve. The funds’ holdings had increased by $1 trillion since 2022 to reach $1.85 trillion by end-December, the researchers including Daniel Barth and Daniel Beltran wrote in an Oct. 15 note. A report from the Department of the Treasury put the funds’ ownership at $423 billion.

articles.title: Zions, Western Alliance Banks Disclose Bad Loans Tied to Alleged Fraud | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Shares of two regional US banks tumbled Thursday after the companies said they were the victims of fraud on loans to funds that invest in distressed commercial mortgages, fueling concern that more cracks are emerging in the credit markets. Zions Bancorp sank 12% after it disclosed a $50 million charge-off for a loan underwritten by its wholly-owned subsidiary, California Bank & Trust, in San Diego. And Western Alliance Bancorp tumbled almost 11% after it said it made loans to the same borrowers.

articles.title: Infosys, Wipro Strong Earnings Growth Cheers Despite India's Shaky Economy
articles.excerpt: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. articles.title: Trump Strikes Deal With German Merck on Tariffs and IVF Costs | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: President Donald Trump announced a deal with Germany’s Merck KGaA to cut the price of some of its fertility medicines in exchange for relief from threatened tariffs, a step toward fulfilling his campaign promise of making IVF less expensive and more widely available in the US. The administration will be issuing guidance to allow employers to offer fertility perks as excepted benefits, a category that includes supplemental health coverage like dental and vision. The guidance will allow employers to offer add-on coverage at a fixed cost for patients and employers.

articles.title: Saks Slashes Outlook and Reports Sales Drop on Inventory Issues | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Saks Global Enterprises slashed full-year guidance and reported a sales decline in an earnings update to investors on Thursday, citing challenges managing the flow of inventory after years of troubled vendor relationships, according to people with knowledge of the results. The luxury retailer saw sales drop to $1.6 billion in the second quarter, down 13% compared to the year-ago period, and lost $77 million by one earnings measure, compared to a $41 million loss in the same quarter last year, said the people, who asked not to be identified discussing private information. It also slashed 2025 earnings guidance by about half, giving a range around $150 million in an investor call Thursday, compared to around $300 million given earlier this year.

articles.title: Stop killings in Gaza or we will have no choice but to go in: Trump threatens Hamas
articles.excerpt: United States President Donald Trump on Thursday issued a warning to Hamas after a video surfaced showing a public execution in Gaza following a ceasefire deal with Israel. The video, widely condemned, prompted Trump to say the US would intervene directly should such executions persist. In a post on his social media, Trump wrote, "If Hamas continues to kill people in Gaza, which was not the Deal, we will have no choice but to go in and kill them.".

articles.title: Banks need stricter controls to prevent romance fraud, says City regulator
articles.excerpt: FCA cites study showing victims’ ‘red flags’ are often missed and calls for improved monitoring systems The City regulator has called on banks and payment firms to bring in stricter controls protecting customers from romance fraud after a study showed a number of missed “red flags” that led to people losing huge sums of money. The review by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) highlighted one case where someone lost £428,000, another where a customer made 403 payments totalling £72,000 to a fraudster and a case where someone wanted money to transfer cryptocurrency to their “partner” in Iraq. Romance scams, where criminals try to build emotional connections with victims before defrauding them, have been growing in scale and complexity in recent years.

articles.title: Launch of veteran card will be used to test UK government’s digital ID scheme
articles.excerpt: Ministers hope scheme for 1.8 million people will show how technology works and ease privacy and security concerns Former military personnel will be used to test and refine the government’s divisive digital ID scheme from Friday, when ministers make a smartphone-based veteran card available to 1.8 million people. The proof of service, which in its current physical version gives access to charities, retail discounts and certain public services, will be the first of a series of official credentials the government wants to let people carry in a government app. Digital driving licences will be in development by the end of this year and by the end of 2027, digital versions of every government-issued credential – including disclosure and barring checks – will be offered for voluntary use, officials said.

articles.title: Hong Kong’s Financial Chief Says About 200 Firms Planning IPOs
articles.excerpt: HSBC Holdings Plc has vowed to invest billions of dollars over the next few years and not conduct any layoffs as part of the lender’s proposed deal to take its troubled Hong Kong subsidiary private, according to the city’s top finance official. HSBC told the government that “substantial investment will be made” in the “billions of dollars” in Hong Kong and the region during its proposed privatization of Hang Seng Bank Ltd., Financial Secretary Paul Chan said in an interview with Bloomberg Television. The investment will be spent over the next few years in areas like customer services, technology and boosting the private wealth business, he added..

articles.title: MP Job Crisis: Lakhs Overaged For SI Posts After 8-Year Wait, Govt Promise Ignored
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on India's complex diplomatic and economic choices under pressure from Donald Trump's administration, featuring analysis from KC Singh, Ashok Malik, Willem Buiter, Rahul Ahluwalia, and Alexander Slater. Rahul Ahluwalia advises, 'never argue with a fool, they'll drag you down to their level and beat you with experience.' The discussion weighs the strategic importance of a trade deal with the United States against the benefits of importing discounted Russian oil. Experts debate whether India should publicly confront Trump's assertions or pursue quiet, backroom diplomacy to resolve the standoff over US tariffs, which have impacted key Indian export sectors like textiles and jewellery.

articles.title: Bihar Polls: NDA Finalises Candidates, Mahagatbandhan Faces Seat-Sharing Deadlock
articles.excerpt: This report covers the escalating controversy over the Election Commission's (EC) directive to verify the identity of burqa-clad women at polling stations in Bihar. The move, protested by opposition groups like the Samajwadi Party, is being defended by the EC as a crucial step for fair elections. The Election Commission stated this move is based on a 1994 order and is 'a step towards making sure that elections are fair.' articles.title: OTT accessibility guidelines for hearing, visually impaired to be finalised in 3 months: Delhi HC told | Mint
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 16 (PTI) The Centre on Thursday informed the Delhi High Court that it would finalise the accessibility guidelines for hearing and visually impaired persons on over-the-top (OTT) platforms in the next three months. Justice Sachin Datta took on record the government undertaking that the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting (MIB) has published the draft guidelines on its official website for comments from stakeholders and public. The court was hearing a petition filed by visually impaired persons who were aggrieved by the lack of disabled-friendly accessibility features in recently released Bollywood movies on OTT platforms..

articles.title: Delhi Gasps: Pollution Causes Heart Attacks, Strokes, Reduces Lifespan, Doctors Warn
articles.excerpt: This special report focuses on 12th-grade student Adith Kumar and his investigation into serious flaws within Delhi's air quality monitoring system, which are now corroborated by a CAG report. Adith Kumar states that upon questioning the authorities about the report's findings, he was told 'action had not been taken despite it being over almost a year since it has been published.' Through RTI appeals, Adith uncovered that AQI monitoring stations are allegedly placed in violation of CPCB guidelines, such as near forested areas, potentially to display lower pollution readings. This programme explores his findings, the damning 2025 Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report that confirms these irregularities, and the bureaucratic apathy that allows this flawed data to misinform public health decisions in the capital..

articles.excerpt: Governor of Israel's central bank Amir Yaron Israel’s central bank chief said policymakers will move “very cautiously” on interest-rate cuts given the uncertainty over the US-orchestrated ceasefire deal to end the war with Hamas. articles.title: Firing at Kapil Sharma’s Kap's cafe in Canada, third attack in 4 months
articles.excerpt: Kapil Sharma’s popular cafe in Surrey, Canada, Kap's Cafe, has come under attack for the third time, with a gunman opening fire in a brazen act captured on video on Thursday. The latest incident has been claimed by associates of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, with Kulveer Sidhu and Goldy Dhillon taking responsibility in a social media post.DETAILS OF THE SHOOTING The video circulating online shows multiple rounds being fired at the cafe, which had only recently reopened after damage sustained during previous attacks. The shooters were reportedly unmasked and aggressive, adding to concerns over public safety.

articles.excerpt: '777 Partners' co-founder Josh Wander Josh Wander, the co-founder of Miami investment firm 777 Partners, was charged with conspiracy and fraud for allegedly cheating lenders and investors in the firm out of almost $500 million. According to Manhattan federal prosecutors, Wander lied and used fake financial documents to inflate the firm’s finances. Wander surrendered to federal agents Thursday morning and was expected to appear in court later in the day..
